title: Disgraced cop to testify at Brooklyn man's exoneration hearing
text:
Retired NYPD detective who allegedly forced confessions to testify at hearing of Brooklyn man acquitted of murder Disgraced cop to testify at Brooklyn man's exoneration hearing Sundhe Moses, 41, testified that he was beaten, choked, forced to strip, had a chair thrown at him and cigar smoke blown in his face by Detective Louis Scarcella (pictured). (John Taggart/John Taggart for The New York Ti) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Wednesday, February 8, 2017, 6:38 PM 
The infamous retired NYPD detective behind several overturned convictions is expected to testify in the hearing of another man accusing him of coercing a confession. 
Sundhe Moses has waited almost four years to clear his name for the August 1995 murder of 4-year-old Shamone Johnson in Brownsville, Brooklyn. 
Moses, 41, testified on his own behalf at trial that he was beaten, choked, forced to strip, had a chair thrown at him and cigar smoke blown in his face by Detective Louis Scarcella. 
Scarcella’s purported tactics allegedly forced Moses to falsely confess to his involvement with the stray bullet murder.

Terrence Morgan was convicted for using a gun to shoot into a crowd of people on a bench where children were playing, but was acquitted for the murder. 
Morgan testified at the ongoing hearing on Monday in front of Justice Dineen Riviezzo that he participated in the shooting with two other men, not Moses. Sundhe Moses has waited almost four years to clear his name for the August 1995 murder of 4-year-old Shamone Johnson in Brownsville, Brooklyn. 
Moses was in prison for 18 years for the murder and released on parole in the fall of 2013. 
The judge will determine if Moses’ conviction should be overturned.

Moses' attorneys Leah Busby and Ron Kuby will schedule the former homicide detective to testify at the hearing in Brooklyn Supreme Court and thoroughly probe him on his decades of alleged misconduct. 
Despite the prosecutor’s Conviction Review Unit dismissing three cases where allegations against Scarcella were documented, they repeated a second time in a week that they haven’t conceded to any wrongdoing. 
The laundry list of exonerees who accused Scarcella of questionable police strategies include Derrick Hamilton , Shabaka Shakur , John Bunn , Rosean Hargrave , Vanessa Gathers and David Ranta . Tags:
